title: Security guard arrested for manslaughter after 'shoplifter' he tackled died when glass bottles hidden in clothing shattered - Mirror Online
text:
Security guard arrested for manslaughter after 'shoplifter' he tackled died when glass bottles hidden in clothing shattered The man suffered a "significant injury" when glass bottles he was concealing smashed when he was apprehended Share The security guard has been arrested on suspicion of manslaughter after man was fatally injured (Photo: Wiltshire Times / SWNS) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! A security guard has been arrested after a suspected shoplifter he tackled died when glass bottles hidden in his clothing shattered, police said. 
The man, who was homeless, suffered a "significant injury" when he was tackled by the unnamed 20-year-old security guard. 
The staff member has been arrested on suspicion of manslaughter and remains in police custody pending further inquiries, Wiltshire Police said. 
Officers were called to The Shires car park in Trowbridge just after 3pm on February 9 to reports a man was seriously injured following an altercation with another man. The man arrested is a security guard from a local store, cops said (Photo: Wiltshire Times / SWNS) Formal identification of the dead man is yet to be carried out (Photo: Wiltshire Times / SWNS) 
The 30-year-old victim, of no fixed address, was pronounced dead at the scene. 
Police said he was suspected of committing a number of shoplifting offences in the town. 
Detective Chief Inspector Jeremy Carter said: "The man arrested is a security guard from a local store. 
"He tackled the suspected shoplifter causing a number of glass bottles he was concealing to smash. Officers were called to The Shires car park in Trowbridge just after 3pm on February 9 (Photo: SWNS) 
"This caused a significant injury to the man who, despite the best efforts from paramedics, sadly died." 
Formal identification is yet to be carried out and a post-mortem examination is due to be carried out later. 
Police are appealing for witnesses to the incident to come forward. Like us on Facebook
